meanings.definition: Hold the attention of (someone) to the exclusion of all else or so as to transfix them.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks seemed to mesmerize the audience, keeping them completely focused.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful sunset never fails to mesmerize me with its stunning colors.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics mesmerized the children, making them forget about everything else.
meanings.sent4: The music had a mesmerizing effect on her, as if it had cast a spell on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful movements were so mesmerizing that the entire room fell silent in awe.

meanings.sent1: The hypnotist tried to mesmerize the volunteer into a deep sleep on stage.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious pendant seemed to mesmerize anyone who gazed at it for too long.
meanings.sent3: The idea of time travel can mesmerize the imagination, leading to wild theories.
meanings.sent4: The swirling patterns on the hypnotist's watch seemed to mesmerize the audience into a trance.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a way of mesmerizing readers, drawing them into its fantastical world.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling movie plot managed to mesmerize the entire audience in the theater.
meanings.sent2: The charismatic speaker had a way of mesmerizing his listeners with his powerful words.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the story managed to mesmerize even the most skeptical viewers.
meanings.sent4: The intricate details of the painting seemed to mesmerize art enthusiasts for hours.
meanings.sent5: The grand fireworks display never failed to mesmerize the crowd gathered in the park.
